comment: Very boring class and we read a book over 600 pages it was very time consuming and he made us do podcast. Strict grading over little things like a few spelling mistakes
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Attendance isn't mandatory but most of the content is through lectures that HE WON'T POST ONLINE. You're essentially screwed if an emergency comes up for the lecture unless you have a reliable person to get notes from. So much boring filler, like he finishes lecture but doesn't want us to leave early so he just rambles until time is up. Boring.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: This class is a cake walk compared to 1101. He's not really concerned so much with content or the effectiveness of your argument, but rather grammar. Hopefully if you're in college, this shouldn't be a problem. All about conspiracy theories, sort of thinks he's a psychologist. Class is brutal. Group projects are unnecessary and annoying. Easy A.

Wrote about conspiracy theories throughout the whole class which I hated. Why limit us to a confined theme? On top of that, we couldn't change our topic at all, he was very unhelpful in giving advice, and then he failed my final paper which shouldn't have made sense. All the papers leading up to the final, I got B's on until the last one. Horrible.

As long as you know what he's looking for and tailor your essay to his personal rubric (there's no physical rubric; you just go by what he tells you) then you'll be able to pass easily-unless you have poor grammar. He have me a B on a paper once because my sentence structure was "confusing" and I didn't write in active voice.

Easy A or B. It was all about Conspiracy theories and about four papers on it. Nice guy but a boring class. Quizzes every once in a while but open book. 20% of your grade is a presentation on your conspiracy theory and as long as you know about it then its a easy 100.
He makes you go to class. Why are you in in school if you dont want to go to class? Go to class and you shall pass.
DO NOT TAKE HIM. Basically a research class and nothing else. Not very good at giving feedback on essays either.

The course was directed towards conspiracy theories which I thought was an interesting topic, however, there wasn't much deep intellectual thought that went into the analysis of conspiracies. Much of what was analysed about conspiracies was on a very basic level. This class was also incredibly easy in comparison to ENGL 1101. Wouldn't suggest.

This is probably the least favorite class I've ever taken. The man is god awful boring, which is compounded by the fact attendance is mandatory. Grades a lot like a high school professor(lots of attention to grammar and spelling, but almost none for the actual content). Easy A as long as you write cookie cutter papers modeled after the book.
Extremely boring guy. He may be a nice guy but his class is a pain. He TRIES to have discussions but no one wants to talk. Boring. Painful. Would not take him again
Great guy. Pretty easy grader if you follow the rubrics. Extremely helpful if you have a question and really sparks some creativity.

He definitely does not give enough information for assignments. He is a great guy, great powerpoints, and loves open class discussion (which is a plus). Towards the end of the semester he gives a lot of useless busy work but it will boost your grade. Pretty much easy A as long as you go to class.
I hated the class mostly that stupid grammar book. He was helpful in some areas but in most areas you was basically on your won. I wasn't too pleased with his teaching method either.
Very helpful.  Will work with in anyway to help you pass

This is this the worst teacher I have ever had. Not only is he hard, he is useless. He doesn't give any guidance or any help for any of his assignments, so basically your on your own. Don't take this teacher because you will regret it like I did.

Good teacher and a nice guy.  He was very busy during the semester because he also goes to college himself and teaches high school, so he is slow to grade, but pretty fair overall. Not difficult or over abundance of work to do... I would take him again.
